result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant not eligible for court appointed counsel through Dane County - income over established guideline.

11:27 AM Defendant Arcelie R Koons in court.  Prosecuting attorney Rebekah M Rennicke in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Does not qualify for SPD.  Will get paystub and apply within 3 weeks at CDP.
Paid interpreter fees for services on 6/30/22 to Glen King, batch 6524.
Status conference on August 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Shawn M. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

08:51 AM Defendant appeared.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Glen King, via telephone, duly sworn & interpreted. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.

09:18 AM Defendant appeared.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Bail argument by State. Court inquired defendant regarding need for interpreter. Court vacated plea and rescheduled Initial Appearance. Initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
